Package com.epsonconnectjava

Class Client

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.epsonconnectjava.Client
  • public class Client
extends java.lang.Object
    The Client class provides functionality for interacting with the Epson Connect API. It allows setting up an authentication context, deauthenticating, and obtaining Printer and Scanner objects.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static class  Client.ClientError
      Custom exception class to handle client-related errors.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description

      Deauthenticates the client from the Epson Connect API.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Client

        public Client​(java.lang.String printerEmail,
              java.lang.String clientId,
              java.lang.String clientSecret)
        Initializes a new Client object with default baseUrl.
        Parameters:
        printerEmail - Email associated with the printer.
        clientId - Client ID for API authentication.
        clientSecret - Client secret for API authentication.
        Throws:
        Client.ClientError - If essential parameters (printerEmail, clientId, or clientSecret) are missing.

      • Client

        public Client​(java.lang.String baseUrl,
              java.lang.String printerEmail,
              java.lang.String clientId,
              java.lang.String clientSecret,
              java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> env)
        Initializes a new Client object.
        Parameters:
        baseUrl - Base URL for the API. Falls back to the default if not provided.
        printerEmail - Email associated with the printer.
        clientId - Client ID for API authentication.
        clientSecret - Client secret for API authentication.
        env - A map containing environment variables.
        Throws:
        Client.ClientError - If essential parameters (printerEmail, clientId, or clientSecret) are missing.

    • Method Detail

      • deauthenticate

        public void deauthenticate()
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Deauthenticates the client from the Epson Connect API.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If there's an issue during deauthentication.
